Japanese: みんなさん/　みなさん
English: ladies and gentlemen, all of you everyone
Mr./Ms. (title added to name for respect)
suffix added to child or girls name
suffix meaning a national of some country

How do you do?
said when you meet someone for first time

Japanese: どうぞよろしくおねぎいします
English:
Nice to meet you or please be kind to me
Usually said at the last of introduction

Japanese: こちらは　～さん　です。
